nsp.impl

Class RasterMosaic

  • java.lang.Object
    • nsp.impl.RasterMosaic
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable, Mosaic

    public class RasterMosaic
extends java.lang.Object
implements Mosaic, java.lang.Cloneable
    Performs operations on a collection of Patch objects, and saves information relating to the collection as a whole. Operations contained within the class are needed when dependencies arise among the Patch objects (as opposed to process that affect them independently of one another).

      • infest

        public void infest(java.util.List<com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.Coordinate> propagules)
        Infests the mosaic according to a List of coordinate values. Note(!) infestation *must* happen at the Mosaic level due to dependencies on implementation-specific variables such as raster parameters - e.g. cell size and index-based searching.
        Specified by:
        infest in interface Mosaic

      • setup

        public void setup(int nrows,
         int ncols,
         double cellsize,
         double llx,
         double lly)
        Sets up the array of cells based on the parameters provided
        Parameters:
        nrows - - number of rows
        ncols - - number of columns
        cellsize - - cell size (side length of a square)
        llx - - lower left corner x coordinate
        lly - - lower left corner y coordinate

           throws java.io.IOException
        Sets up the array of cells based on a Raster template

      • getPatches

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,Patch> getPatches()
        Retrieves a map of cell objects. Integer value corresponds to the unique index of the cell, defined as row*number of columns + column
        Specified by:
        getPatches in interface Mosaic

      • setDisperser

        public void setDisperser(Disperser d)
        Sets a copy of the provided Disperser to all patches in the RasterMosaic. We make multiple clones otherwise source positioning would have to be handled at the level of the Patch.
        Specified by:
        setDisperser in interface Mosaic
        Parameters:
        d - - the Disperser object to be used.

      • setDisperser

        public void setDisperser(Disperser d,
                java.lang.Integer key)
        Sets the provided Disperser to a single Patch in the RasterMosaic based on its key. Note: the Disperser is *not* cloned. Instead, the reference is passed.
        Specified by:
        setDisperser in interface Mosaic
        Parameters:
        d - - the Disperser object to be used.
        key - - the key value identifying the Patch to which the Disperser should be applied.
